1.t: By the winds which carry dust particles,

2.t: by the clouds which are heavily loaded with water,

3.t: by the ships which smoothly sail on the oceans,

4.t: by the angels which distribute the affairs,

5.t: that what you are promised is certainly true

6.t: and the Day of Judgment will inevitably take place.

9.t: Let whoever wishes, turn away from Our Quran.

10.t: Death to those whose opinions are merely baseless conjectures.

11.t: and who wander in the abyss of confusion.

12.t: They ask, "When it will be the Day of Judgment?"

13.t: On the Day of Judgment they will be punished by the fire

14.t: and will be told, "Suffer the torment which you wanted to experience immediately".
14.tr: Zooqoo fitnatakum haa-zal lazee kuntum bihee tas-ta'jiloon

15.t: The pious ones will live amidst gardens and springs,

16.t: receiving their reward from their Lord. They had been righteous people before the Day of Judgment.
16.tr: Aakhizeena maaa aataahum Rabbuhum; innahum kaanoo qabla zaalika muhsineen

17.t: They slept very little during the night
17.tr: kaanoo qaleelam minal laili maa yahja'oon

18.t: and asked for forgiveness in the early morning.

19.t: They assigned a share of their property for the needy and the destitute.

20.t: In the earth there is evidence (of the Truth) for those who have strong faith.

21.t: There is also evidence of the Truth within your own selves. Will you then not see?

22.t: In the heavens there is your sustenance and that which you were promised (Paradise).

23.t: This, by the Lord of the heavens and the earth is as certain as your ability to speak.
23.tr: Fawa-Rabbis samaaa'i wal-ardi innahoo lahaqqum misla maa annakum tantiqoon

24.t: Have you heard the story of the honorable guests of Abraham?
24.tr: Hal ataaka hadeesu daifi Ibraaheemal mukrameen

25.t: When they came to him saying, "Peace be with you," he replied to their greeting in the same manner and said to himself, "These are a strange people".
25.tr: Iz dakhaloo 'alaihi faqaaloo salaaman qaala salaamun qawmum munkaroon

26.t: He went quietly to his wife and returned to his guests with a fat, roasted calf.
26.tr: Faraagha ilaaa ahlihee fajaaa'a bi'ijlin sameen

27.t: He placed it before them. Then he said, "Why are you not eating?"

28.t: He began to feel afraid. They said, "Do not be afraid," and then gave him the glad news of the birth of a knowledgeable son.
28.tr: Fa-awjasa minhum khee-fatan qaaloo laa takhaf Wa-bashsharoohu bighulaamin 'aleem

29.t: His wife came forward, crying and beating her face, saying, "I am an old barren woman!"
29.tr: Fa-aqbalatim ra-atuhoo fee sarratin fasakkat wajhahaa Wa-qaalat 'ajoozun 'aqeem

30.t: They said, "This is true but your Lord has said, (that you will have a son); He is All-wise and All-knowing".
30.tr: Qaaloo kazaaliki qaala Rabbuki innahoo huwal hakeemul 'aleem

31.t: Abraham asked, "Messengers, what is your task?"

32.t: They replied, "We have been sent to a sinful people
32.tr: Qaalooo innaaa ursilnaaa ilaa qawmim mujrimeen

33.t: to bring down upon them showers of marked lumps of clayy.

34.t: They are transgressors in the presence of your Lord".

35.t: We saved the believers among them,
35.tr: Fa-akhrajnaa man kaana feehaa minal mu'mineen

36.t: but We found only one Muslim house.
36.tr: Famaa wajadnaa feehaa ghaira baitim minal muslimeen

37.t: We left therein evidence for those who fear the painful torment.
37.tr: Wa-taraknaa feehaaa aayatal lillazeena yakhaafoonal 'azaabal aleem

38.t: There is also evidence (of the Truth) in the story of Moses when We sent him to the Pharaoh with clear authority.
38.tr: Wa-fee Moosaaa iz arsalnaahu ilaa Fir'awna bisultaa-nim mubeen

39.t: The Pharaoh and his forces turned away from him, saying, "He is either a magician or an insane person".
39.tr: Fatawalla biruknihee Wa-qaala saahirun aw majnoon

40.t: We seized him and his army and threw them into the sea. He himself was to be blamed.
40.tr: Fa-akhaznaahu Wa-junoo-dahoo fanabaznaahum fil yammi Wa-huwa muleem

41.t: There is also evidence of the Truth in the story of Ad whom We struck with a violent wind

42.t: which turned everything it approached into dust.
42.tr: Maa tazaru min shai'in atat 'alaihi illaa ja'alat-hu karrameem

43.t: There is also evidence (of the Truth) in the story of the Thamud, who were told to enjoy themselves for an appointed time.
43.tr: Wa-fee Samooda iz qeela lahum tamatta''oo hattaa heen

44.t: They transgressed against the command of their Lord. So a blast of sound struck them and they were unable to do anything but stare.
44.tr: Fa'ataw 'an amri Rabbihim fa-akhazal-humus saa'iqatu Wa-hum yanzuroon

45.t: They were unable to stand up, nor were they helped.
45.tr: Famas tataa'oo min qiyaaminw Wa-maa kaanoo muntasireen

46.t: The people of Noah who lived before them were also evil doing people.
46.tr: Wa-qawma Noohim min qablu innahum kaano qawman faasiqeen

47.t: We have made the heavens with Our own hands and We expanded it.

48.t: We have spread out the earth and how brilliantly it is spread!

49.t: We have created everything in pairs so that perhaps you may take heed.
49.tr: Wa-min kulli shai'in khalaqnaa zawjaini la'allakum tazakkaroon

50.t: (Muhammad), tell them,"Seek refuge in God. I have been sent from Him to plainly warn you.
50.tr: Fafirrooo ilal laahi innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen

51.t: Do not choose other gods besides Him. I have been sent from Him to plainly warn you".
51.tr: Wa-laa taj'aloo ma'al laahi ilaahan aakhara innee lakum minhu nazeerum mubeen

52.t: In the same way no Messenger came to those who lived before them without his people calling him a magician or an insane person.
52.tr: Kazaalika maaa atal lazeena min qablihim mir Rasoolin illaa qaaloo saahirun aw majnoon

53.t: Have they inherited such dealings with the Prophets from their predecessors or are they a rebellious people?
53.tr: Atawaasaw bih; bal hum qawmun taaghoon

54.t: (Muhammad), leave them alone and you will not be blamed.

55.t: Keep on reminding them. This benefits the believers.

56.t: We have created jinn and human beings only that they might worship Me.
56.tr: Wa-maa khalaqtul jinna wal-insa illaa liya'budoon

57.t: I do not expect to receive any sustenance from them or that they should feed Me.
57.tr: Maaa ureedu minhum mir rizqinw Wa-maaa ureedu aien yut'imoon

58.t: It is God Who is the Sustainer and the Lord of invincible strength.
58.tr: Innal laaha Huwar Razzaaqu Zul Quwwatil Mateen

59.t: The unjust will bear a burden like that of their unjust predecessors. Let them not make Me bring immediate punishment upon them.
59.tr: Fa-inna lillazeena zalamoo zanoobam misla zanoobi ashaabihim falaa yasta'jiloon

60.t: Woe to the disbelievers when the day with which they have been threatened comes!
60.tr: Fawailul lillazeena kafaroo mien yawmihimul lazee yoo'adoon
